title: جَمْع التَّكْسِير - الأَوْزَان
description: Learn the common patterns (أَوْزَان) of جَمْع التَّكْسِير (broken plurals) in Arabic, including أَفْعَال، فُعُول، فِعَال، أَفْعِلَة، فَعَائِل and their usage rules.

notes.title: What is جَمْع التَّكْسِير?
content: جَمْع التَّكْسِير (broken plural) is a plural form that changes the internal structure of the singular noun, unlike the sound plurals (جَمْع السَّالِم) which only add suffixes. It is called 'broken' because the original pattern of the word is 'broken' and reformed.

Broken plurals are very common in Arabic and follow specific patterns (أَوْزَان). Learning these patterns helps predict the plural of many nouns. Each singular pattern often corresponds to specific plural patterns.
keyPoints: جَمْع التَّكْسِير = plural with internal change
Changes the بِنْيَة (structure) of the singular
Most common type of plural for Arabic nouns

notes.title: Pattern: أَفْعَال
content: The pattern أَفْعَال is one of the most common broken plural patterns. It typically pluralizes singular nouns on the patterns فَعْل and فِعْل (three-letter words with sukun on the middle letter).
This is a جَمْع قِلَّة (plural of paucity), theoretically referring to 3-10 items, though in practice this distinction is often ignored in modern Arabic.
keyPoints: أَفْعَال pluralizes فَعْل and فِعْل singulars
Adds أَ at beginning, fathas throughout

notes.title: Pattern: فُعُول
content: The pattern فُعُول is a جَمْع كَثْرَة (plural of abundance) that pluralizes nouns on the pattern فَعْل (three letters with sukun on the second). It is characterized by ضَمَّة on both the first and second letters.
This pattern is extremely productive and covers a large number of common Arabic nouns, especially concrete nouns referring to body parts, buildings, and physical objects.

notes.title: Patterns: فِعَال and أَفْعِلَة
content: فِعَال is a جَمْع كَثْرَة pattern that pluralizes nouns on فَعْل and فَاعِل. It is characterized by كَسْرَة on the first letter followed by alif. Many human nouns and some animal names use this pattern.
أَفْعِلَة is a جَمْع قِلَّة that typically pluralizes four-letter nouns (especially those with medial و or ي like فِعَال and فَعِيل). It adds أَ at the beginning and ends with ـِلَة.
keyPoints: فِعَال common for humans and animals

notes.title: Patterns: فَعَائِل and فَوَاعِل
content: فَعَائِل pluralizes feminine nouns on فَعِيلَة and فَعَالَة. The ي or ا of the singular becomes ء (hamza) in the plural. This pattern is very common for abstract feminine nouns.
فَوَاعِل pluralizes nouns on فَاعِل and فَاعِلَة, especially active participles used as nouns. The ا of the singular becomes و in the plural, followed by ا and كَسْرَة.
keyPoints: فَعَائِل: for فَعِيلَة and فَعَالَة singulars
فَوَاعِل: for فَاعِل and فَاعِلَة singulars
Common for feminine nouns and participles
